snippet: A federal jury in Louisiana found for five Indian guest workers who said they were lured to the United States with false promises of permanent residency and forced to live in inhumane conditions.
abstract: Federal jury in Louisiana awards $14 million in damages to five Indian guest workers who said they were lured to United States under false promises of permanent residency by Gulf Coast maritime services firm Signal International; workers said they were forced to live in inhumane conditions.
lead_paragraph: A federal jury in Louisiana found for five Indian guest workers who said they were lured to the United States with false promises of permanent residency and forced to live in inhumane conditions.
